main event: A circular, bright white object was observed in the sky near Ferndale, Michigan on October 12, 1961.
interesting points: The object appeared to move erratically, making turns and traveling at a fairly high rate of speed.
The object gave the illusion of a directed or controlled flight rather than a random or natural object.
There was a strong breeze and rapidly moving clouds at the time of the observation.
The witness was unable to determine the distance, size, or altitude of the object.
The object was reported as unidentified due to insufficient data for evaluation.
